intro: Cayratia corniculata, commonly known as the horned cayratia, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a faintly aromatic scent. Its fruits are typically berries that turn red when mature, containing several small seeds. Cayratia corniculata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
